meanings.definition: To purchase more of something than is needed or can be used.
meanings.sent1: I tend to overbuy groceries and end up throwing away a lot of food.
meanings.sent2: She always overbuys clothes during sales and then regrets it later.
meanings.sent3: My friend likes to overbuy snacks for movie nights, but we never finish them all.
meanings.sent4: Sometimes it feels like I overbuy time, trying to fit too many things into one day.
meanings.sent5: The urge to overbuy can lead to clutter and waste in our homes.

meanings.definition: To buy excessively or beyond what is necessary.
meanings.sent1: He tends to overbuy gadgets, always getting the latest technology.
meanings.sent2: They overbuy souvenirs whenever they travel, filling their bags with trinkets.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally overbought party decorations, now my house looks like a carnival.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter overbought the room, filling it with joy and warmth.
meanings.sent5: The excitement of the auction made him overbuy, bidding way more than he planned.
